Row.Text: Bonus [ICON_Production] Production equal to the adjacency bonus of the Harbor district.
Receive a free Settler in your capital upon completion.
Receive 2 free Settlers in your capital upon completion.
Receive a free Settler in your capital upon completion.
Receive a free Settler in your capital upon completion.
Receive a free Settler in your capital upon completion.
Allows the building of National Parks. Allows units to plant Woods (second-growth). Woods in your territory that have never been removed (old-growth) gain +1 Appeal.
Receive a free Settler in your capital upon completion.
Outback Stations receive +1 [ICON_Food] Food for every two adjacent Outback Stations.
Can be completed multiple times, but in this scenario it does NOT increase your points towards the Score Victory.
Completing any district causes a Culture Bomb.

Unlocks the Prospector ability to construct Mines.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Production] Production. +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold. -1 Appeal. Can only be built on Hills or certain resources.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If built on Luxury or Strategic resources, city will gain use of that resource.

Unlocks the Grazier ability to construct Pastures.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Production] Production. +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold. Can only be built on [ICON_RESOURCE_CATTLE] Cattle, [ICON_RESOURCE_SHEEP] Sheep, or [ICON_RESOURCE_HORSES] Horse resources.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If built on a [ICON_RESOURCE_HORSES] Horse resource, the city will gain use of that resource.

Unlocks the Grazier ability to construct an Outback Station.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_FOOD] Food, +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold and +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production. +1 [ICON_Food] Food for each adjacent Pasture. Additional [ICON_FOOD] Food and [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production as you advance through the Technology and Civic Tree for adjacent Outback Stations and Pastures. Can only be built in Desert, Desert Hills, Grassland, and Plains tiles.

Unlocks the Naturalist ability to construct Seaside Resorts.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Provides [ICON_Gold] equal to the tile's Appeal. Can only be built on Coastal Desert, Coastal Plains, or Coastal Grassland tiles. Minimum Appeal of Breathtaking.

Unlocks the Farmer ability to construct Plantations.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Gold] Gold. Can only be built on [ICON_RESOURCE_BANANAS] Bananas, [ICON_RESOURCE_CITRUS] Citrus, [ICON_RESOURCE_COTTON] Cotton, [ICON_RESOURCE_SUGAR] Sugar, [ICON_RESOURCE_TEA] Tea, or [ICON_RESOURCE_WINE] Wine resources.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If built on a Luxury resource, the city will gain use of that resource.
One tile impassable natural wonder. Provides +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold to adjacent tiles. Provides +4 Appeal to adjacent tiles instead of the usual +2.
Newly trained Farmers gain 2 extra build actions.
+1 [ICON_Food] Food and +1 [ICON_Production] Production from domestic [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes.
Newly trained Graziers gain 2 extra build actions.
+1 [ICON_Gold] Gold from Farm and Plantation improvements.
+2 [ICON_Gold] Gold from all Quarries and Mine improvements on Luxury resources.
+1 [ICON_Gold] Gold from Pasture and Outback Station improvements.
+4 [ICON_Gold] Gold from Mine improvements on Strategic resources.
All tiles in your civilization gain +2 Appeal. -1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold from Mine improvements.
Farm improvements now gain +1 [ICON_Food] Food for each adjacent Farm improvement when 3 Farm improvements are adjacent to each other.
Allows chopping of Woods and Rainforest. Your units gain a better chance of surviving in the Outback and map more territory if they receive beneficial events in the Outback.
Your units gain a better chance of surviving in the Outback and map more territory if they receive beneficial events in the Outback.
Upgrades Farm improvements to Mechanized Agriculture. +1 [ICON_Food] Food Adjacency bonus for every Farm improvement they are adjacent to.
Outback Stations receive +1 [ICON_Production] Production for every two adjacent Outback Stations. Pastures receive +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] for every adjacent Outback Station.
Fast moving recon unit. Civilian unit that cannot attack in this scenario.
May create Mine, Quarry, Oil Well and Airstrip tile improvements. Prospectors can be used 3 times.
May create Pasture and Outback Station tile improvements. Graziers can be used 3 times. This can be increased through the Mounted Stockmen policy.
May create Farm, Plantation and Lumber Mill tile improvements. Farmers can be used 3 times. This can be increased through the Terra Nullius policy.
May create Fishing Boat tile improvements. Fishers can be used 3 times.
May create new cities. Settlers are only received in this scenario by completing Civics. They can never be built.

A late-game civilian who can create either a single Seaside Resort or a single National Park to increase [ICON_Gold] Gold per [ICON_Turn] Turn. Removed from play after Seaside Resort or National Park is created.
Have a [ICON_GOLD] Gold per [ICON_Turn] Turn of 15.
Grow your civilization to at least 12 population.
Have a [ICON_GOLD] Gold per [ICON_Turn] Turn of 30.
Gold fever is upon us! Fortune hunters from every continent rush to Australia to try and strike it rich.
The profits are starting to build. The Queen will soon establish your lands as a proper crown colony.
With so much open space in this land, raising sheep seems like a winning proposition.
With so many citizens, some are finding time to explore the arts.
Your tidy profit from pastures is attracting government interest. They may soon lease out crown lands.
As you prosper, native-born Australians clamor for their own nation, independent from Britian.
Your large city is getting overcrowded. It's time to start planning for some suburbs.
The natural beauty of this land is unmatched and must be preserved for future generations.
The Great Powers have been drawn into a bloody conflict. Time to rally to the Mother Country!
Aircraft have come to Australia. Surely they are just the ticket to service the vast Outback?
The forces of fascism have risen in Germany and Japan. Could even Australia itself be at risk?
Your new national park could become a major destination for the new, ocean-going passenger liners.
Have the The Great War civic.
Have the World War II civic.
Your new urban center is a prime spot for a center of learning featuring a library and university.
Your lucrative trade network has given us capital to spare. Setting up banks now could fuel further investments.
With numerous mines active, the materials for progress are at hand. Is an Industrial Revolution about to begin?
The stone from your quarries now give us the foundation for great works of engineering.
With two libraries active, your scientific community is off and running.
Your commercial successes have encouraged many to make investments in your economy.
Your industrial production is impressive but could advance further with the introduction of electric power.
Australian aviators have returned from the war with stories of their flights over the trenches of Europe.
With the Japanese empire expanding, competition for Pacific oil resources is growing fierce.
Finishing a modern research facility will let you keep up with the most recent advances in communications.
With an aerodrome and hangar in place, you are ready to begin work on a modern airport.

The Australian Imperial Force (AIF) project recruits troops for overseas deployment during the World Wars. Completing it in a city provides a large boost to that city's [ICON_Gold] Gold per [ICON_Turn] Turn.

All land tiles not controlled by a player are considered to be a part of the Australian Outback, a dangerous abode plagued by poisonous plants and animals and home to one of the harshest climates on the planet. Any unit that ends a turn in an Outback tile may experience a special Outback encounter. Although many of these events cause damage or delays, there are a select few that will help your exploring unit gain unique bonuses. In general though you'll want to limit the time your units spend out in such an untamed wilderness.
